name: The Pool Guy Quiz / Test | 'Seinfeld' - Season 7 | 10 Questions

questions.text: According to Elaine, who would win in a fight between George and Jerry?
questions.explanation:
George.

	In the beginning of the episode, George brings up the question of who would ultimately win and Elaine comments that George would because he wouldn't be concerned with fighting dirty.  George comments that he would do anything to hinder his opponent to win.  After this, Elaine asks Jerry and George to see a historical clothing exhibit with her at the Met, but they refuse to go and she says that she has no female friends.

questions.text: What is the name of the pool guy that Jerry runs into outside the movie theater?
questions.explanation:
Ramon.

	While waiting in line to see a movie, Kramer comments on how too many women know his number.  Shortly after, Jerry runs into his local gym's pool guy and discovers that he was fired for putting too much chlorine into the pool.  Meanwhile, Elaine decides to ask Susan, George's fiancée, to the clothing exhibit after Jerry's suggestion.

questions.text: Jerry and Kramer sit next to each other at the movie theater.
questions.explanation:
False.

	When they get into the movie, Jerry asks Kramer to sit in the next seat over for a bit of a buffer zone.  He explains that if he were watching a movie in his apartment, they wouldn't be sitting right next to each other.  This leads Ramon, the pool guy, to take the seat right in between them.  Jerry later refers to him as a leech as they later spent two hours getting coffee with him and he walked them home.

questions.text: What does Kramer's phone number change to?
questions.explanation:
555-FILK.

	After deciding that too many women know his number, Kramer changes his phone number to what Jerry later recognizes as 555-FILK.  When Kramer complains of wrong number every five minutes, Jerry discovers that his new number is strikingly similar to that of Moviefone, which is 555-FILM (one number off).  Meanwhile, George complains that his two worlds are colliding as Susan has accepted Elaine's invitation to the Met.

questions.text: What term does Susan pick up from her lunch with Elaine?
questions.explanation:
'The Vault'.

	After visiting the museum, Elaine and Susan go to Monk's to get a coffee, and later, George discovers that Elaine has been letting Susan into 'The Vault', the hidden cache of secrets embedded into her mind.  George is shocked at this, and he's even more surprised at the fact that Susan has set them all up to see a movie later in the week.  Meanwhile, Jerry has trouble shaking off Ramon and decides to tell him that he can't handle another needy friend while leaving him on the subway.

questions.text: According to George, what is not a component of 'Independent George'?
questions.explanation:
Relationship George.

	After Susan poses the movie idea, George talks to Jerry about the crisis involving his two worlds colliding.  The first George, 'Relationship George' is what he fears will take over his once exciting life as 'Independent George'.  Claims that a George, divided against itself, can not stand.  He yells at Elaine for the situation.

questions.text: Which movie does Elaine call Moviefone about in this episode?
questions.explanation:
Chow Fun.

	Elaine ends up dialing Moviefone after arriving at Jerry's and she ends up listening to Kramer give his impression in an attempt to help her.  Meanwhile, Jerry returns to the pool and finds that Ramon, the pool guy, has gotten his job back.  Ramon ends up giving all of the towels to Newman in order to make Jerry feel uncomfortable.

questions.text: Where does George go after he finds that Susan and all of his friends are eating lunch together?
options: On a subway ride around the city
questions.explanation:
Reggie's Diner.

	While Elaine plans to meet Susan for lunch at the coffee shop, Jerry also plans to meet George at the same time.  Oddly, Kramer is also at the coffee shop, and when George arrives, he takes one look and turns away.  Instead, he opts to eat alone in a booth at Reggie's.  After, Jerry heads to the pool where Ramon bothers him during his swim.  Jerry pulls him into the pool to stop him, but Newman actually jumps onto him and knocks him out.

questions.text: Who performs mouth-to-mouth on the pool guy?
questions.explanation:
None of these.

	After he's knocked out, Ramon is pulled out of the water by Newman and Jerry who consider giving him mouth-to-mouth, but neither of themselves can bring themselves to do it.  Instead, they just accept that they are kicked out of the club.  Both Elaine and Susan are shocked when they hear the story that night as Ramon could have died, but he didn't do anything about it.  Before they leave, Elaine and Susan leave a note for George so he can catch up.

questions.text: What movie do Susan, Elaine, and Jerry watch at the theater together?
questions.explanation:
Chunnel.

	This is another popular movie that was never created outside the series.  While the three are at the theater, George finds the note and decides to follow them, but to figure out which theater to go to, he calls Moviefone.  He ends up getting Kramer instead and accidentally searches through the wrong showing of "Chunnel".  During the movie, Susan is shocked by Elaine and Jerry's annoying commentary and decides not to hang out with them anymore because of their constant talking.  In the end, the Moviefone guy ends up coming to Kramer's apartment to beat him up.
